Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
@Mihailo Making unit tests for ChannelsCC, seems `channelsrefund` is not work at the moment:
```error code: -26
error message:
16: mandatory-script-verify-flag-failed (Script evaluated without error but finished with a false/empty top stack element)```
Get this error on `channelsrefund` transaction broadcast

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: https://paste.ubuntu.com/p/kYHdDv864r/ here is a full flow

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: @TonyL Have you waited for close to be confirmed?

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Can you give me daemon output also?

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Oh, right. How many times it should be confirmed?

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: If you did not complie iwth TESTMODE than 101, but when using TESTMODE then it is 2. If chain has notarization then after block is notarized.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: I made RPC call txnotarizedocnfirmed to test if tx is confirmed/notarized for CC purposes

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Aha, it's a clue I think since I have default compiled daemons at the moment

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Enabled daemon output, it's telling me about it yeah:
```CC Eval EVAL_CHANNELS Invalid: channelOpen is not yet confirmed(notarised)! spending tx b64d277f3f367a29cf98d7d11480dd3d82cdfe20f24daaac6c7b16500854886b
```
Thanks @Mihailo !

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
But I guess "channelClose" is not yet confirmed, not "channelOpen"
Or opening transaction have to be confirmed/notarised X times as well?

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: What is the close txid

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Oh, actually ```CC Eval EVAL_CHANNELS Invalid: channelOpen is not yet confirmed(notarised)! spending tx b64d277f3f367a29cf98d7d11480dd3d82cdfe20f24daaac6c7b16500854886b``` this printout I get in my tests on `channelspayment` tx broadcast
Sorry for things messing up, investigating

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: Yep, so open must be confirmed before payment can be done. Also close must be confirmed before refund can be done.

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Gotcha, will generate needed extra blocks

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: You can use RPC txnotarizedocnfirmed for unit tests so that they do not go to next tx until previous is confirmed.

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
I have ```'confirmations': 2``` on channel opening transaction in tests but getting:
```CC Eval EVAL_CHANNELS Invalid: channelOpen is not yet confirmed(notarised)! spending tx a3bff136ee651c0abf8c84b88a01e58a9eab5b504c5759c3d62fe1e95533f88d
DEBUG:BitcoinRPC:<-- {"result":null,"error":{"code":-26,"message":"16: mandatory-script-verify-flag-failed (Script evaluated without error but finished with a false/empty top stack element)"},"id":26}```
On normal chain I can send `channelpayment` right after `channelopen` transction mined
So it should be some specific thing for `regtest` mode. Will spin now `-regtest` chain outside of test framework to doublecheck it

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content: You shouldn't be able to send payment on either chains. There is a check in validation if open is confirme/notarized.

Author: Mihailo#5902
Content:
Try with make clean and then build client:
```
export CONFIGURE_FLAGS='CPPFLAGS=-DTESTMODE'
./zcutil/build.sh -j8
```

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Thanks @Mihailo it's work correct after I've rebuilt.
It was my brain-lag - just realised that on non test framework chain  I've opened channel yesterday - so channel opening transaction just have needed `101+` confirmations

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: https://github.com/jl777/komodo/pull/1077 @dukeleto @jl777c I've separated a little bit CC tests from "legacy" ones

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: And now it's executing 6 times faster since 100 blocks pre-generates only once if you want to test all CCs - realised that it'll be a problem when CCs amount will grow. There is not beautiful logic now and order in which tests execute is matters (faucet have to be first because other way address will be not brand new, gateways tests create token and oracle so tokens and oracles list will be not empty - thats why gateways test should be after oracles and tokens tests and so on)

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TonyL nice commit message. I feel like some that should go into a README or docs somewhere. we dont' have good docs for how to run the test suite with various options right now

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's not friendly to newcomers, we could change that with some developer docs

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: in theory the tests should be isolated as much as possible, but in practice, we do the best we can

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i ran into the same issues, and had to order tests very particularly

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TonyL i see you updated `qa/rpc-tests/README.md`, very nice

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: our CC tests are really starting to evolve, nice to see

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Thanks for a feedback @dukeleto ! Seems nobody else use these tests so far so I'm not sure what might be useful for newcomer in Readme besides the info which it already have - for me information in Readme was enough for start.
 I'm ready to improve it on any demand/feedback. 
Yup, our tests are growing üôå  Only issue I don't like now is that sometimes to stop komodods after tests finished I need to ```rm -rf /tmp/*
pkill komodod
``` 
But I think I've almost found how to resolve it (besides of execution of code above in .sh directly)))

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @TonyL that thing you notice, when you sometimes have to manually kill regtest daemons, that is somewhat expected

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: if the test suite dies, in certain ways, sometimes regtest daemons do not get cleaned up properly. Exceptions in the test suite libraries themselves. Perhaps we can add more try/catch somewhere to fix this

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: so even if you tell the test suite to clean up, sometimes it fails so hard it does not

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i see this regularly, when messing with test libraries themselves

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: not when messing with test files

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: we have a very ancient version of the python test suite for BTC, the most recent stuff in BTC core is much nicer

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: ZEC does not have that stuff yet either

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: for instance, latest BTC python test suite, you don't have to manually maintain a list of test files

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it will auto-recognize it if the file exists

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: current implementation is .... ugly, imho. But that is what we inherited from btc 0.11

Author: TonyL#3577
Content:
Yeah, python2 + dat .sh script with list seems like an old school )
In general daemons killing is ok as far as tests working correct

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: In general I can make super leightweight tests framework for CC only from 1-2 files I think

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: i think we do need to have a CryptoConditionsTest class that multiple files can inherit from

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: then the code in each file will be only a few lines

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: where as right now, there is a lot of duplication between cc test files, for simplicity

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Yes, definetly

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: now that we have a few cc test files, i think we are at that point

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: to make a class, and all those files inherit from that. You will see this pattern throughout the test suite

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: `setup_chain` `setup_network` `run_test` `send_and_mine` are duplicating all over the CC tests, so possible to move it to common class and inherit then

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: yes, the pattern emerges once a few test files are written

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: Great, was in my todo list actually üëç Will make this class and adjust existing CC tests

Author: TonyL#3577
Content: While there are not a hundreds of CCs yet - things are still under control üòÇ

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: yes, it's the perfect time to refactor, when there are a handful of things. it's not fun when you have to update 100 things
